low.question: Who famously said "Et tu, Brute?" according to tradition?
Who is credited with the last words "I have a terrific headache" before a fatal event?
Which scientist reportedly said "I have not failed" as last words reflecting persistence?
Who is known for the last words "I die hard but am not afraid to go"?
Which American president said "All my possessions for a moment of time" reportedly at death?
Who is reported to have said "Either that wallpaper goes, or I do" as last words?
Which explorer’s purported last words were "I only regret that I have but one life to lose for my country"? (Famous variation)
Who is often quoted as saying "Let us cross over the river and rest under the shade of the trees"?
Which writer reportedly said his last words: "Now I shall go to sleep"?
Who is known to have said "I am ready to meet my Maker" on their deathbed?
Which famous composer said "Play it, Sam" at his death according to popular culture? (Note: misquoted line)
Who reportedly said "I am about to take my last voyage, a great leap in the dark"?
Which abolitionist is credited with the final words "I only regret that I have but one life to lose for my country"?
Who is famous for the defiant last words "I am still standing"?
Which playwright reportedly said "I should never have switched from scotch to martinis" as last words?
Who is often credited with the last words "Et tu, Brute? Then fall, Caesar!" in Shakespeare's play?
Which US founding father said "It is well, I die hard, but I am not afraid to go" on his deathbed?
Who reportedly said "Now I can die, for I have seen tyranny" after witnessing an event?
Which artist is known for the ambiguous last words "I am dying beyond my means"?
Who allegedly said "Go on, get out — last words are for fools who haven't said enough"?
Which US president's last words were reported as "I want to be left alone"?
Who reportedly said "It is very beautiful over there" as their final words referring to a place beyond life?
Which inventor is reported to have said "I will not be there to see the end" near death?
Who is credited with saying "I have offended God and mankind because my work did not reach the quality it should have" on their deathbed?
Which author allegedly said "I must go in, the fog is rising" as his last words?
Who reportedly murmured "I should never have switched from scotch to martinis" as a humorous dying quip?
Which famous admiral is associated with the last line "Kiss me, Hardy"?
Who is known for the last words "Don't let it end like this. Tell them I said something"?
Which composer reportedly said "It is very sad, but it is over" in their final moments?

medium.question: Whose reported dying words were "I have tried so hard to do right"?
Which English king said "Remember for your good the blood you have shed this day" before execution?
Which famous actor said "I'm losing it" just before death from a heart attack on stage?
Who reportedly said "It is a mercy that I have been spared" after surviving an earlier danger and before dying later?
Which French heroine's alleged last words were "I am not afraid; I was born to do this"?
Who said "I should like to be buried in a plain box" as last wishes revealing humility?
Which American writer's final words were reportedly "I want to go home" after long travel and illness?
Which scientist reputedly said "I go to seek a Great Perhaps" on his deathbed?
Which Roman poet is credited with dying words about returning to the Elysian fields?
Who reportedly said "I regret that I am not fit to be buried among saints" before dying?
Which American jazz legend reportedly said "Don't worry about me" before death?
Who is associated with the last words "Let us march on Rome" as a dramatic final phrase? (Historical context matters)
Which author said "I should like to thank God for a happy life" as last words?
Who reportedly said "I'm bored with it all" in their final moments expressing weariness?
Which famous mathematician's last words were "Do not let us quarrel any longer"?
Who is reported to have said "I am a dead man" shortly before dying from an assassination?
Which famous composer reportedly said "Hear my music, my love" as final words to a companion?
Who reportedly said "I must be ready to go" referencing death as a transition?
Which leader said "If only I had served my country as I served my family" in remorse near death?
Who famously said "Drink to me only with thine eyes" as quoted at death in cultural retellings?
Which American civil rights leader is reported to have said "I've been to the mountaintop" just before dying?
Whose last words included a simple request: "Tell my wife I think of her" as they died abroad?
Which poet reportedly murmured "I am dying. I shall sleep well" on their deathbed?
Who said "Whatever happens, you must not be afraid" as calming last words to a loved one?
Which English king allegedly declared "I go from a corruptible to an incorruptible crown" near death?
Who reportedly said "Don't cry for me" as last words inspiring later cultural references?
Which famous scientist's last words were "I will not be in the way of the progress" expressing optimism?
Who said "I am about to die: I expect to be murdered" before being assassinated?
Which novelist reportedly said "It is a far, far better rest that I go to than I have ever known" at the moment of death?

hard.question: Which Irish playwright reportedly muttered "Have I not made a great mistake?" before dying, reflecting on his career?
Who reputedly said "I am the resurrection and the life" as last words during a well-documented final prayer?
Which 19th-century abolitionist's last words were "I have not one regret", uttered before execution in 1859?
Who reportedly said "I am going to the happiest place on earth" referencing heaven as final words?
Which explorer supposedly said "We are now in sight of the promised land" as last words on an expedition?
Who is reported to have said "Either that wallpaper goes or I do" while criticizing decor as last words?
Which composer said in Italian "Pietà, pietà, mio Dio" at the moment of death?
Which Soviet leader is recorded as saying "I am not ready to be a saint" in his final hours?
Who is said to have described death as "the great equaliser" in their final utterance?
Which English poet allegedly said "Now comes the mystery" on his deathbed?
Who reportedly said "Lord help my poor soul" before being executed for rebellion in England?
Which US president said "I hope to have placed my country in the hands of God" as last words?
Who is reported to have said "I am dying as a member of the Church of England" in their final moments?
Which poet is said to have whispered "I am not afraid" before passing away in 1821?
Who uttered the last words "I am going to see now whether God will think me a good man"?
Which American gangster reportedly said "I made my bed, I lie in it" as final remarks?
Who is credited with telling a confidant "I told you I was ill" moments before death?
Which Renaissance artist said "I have offended God and mankind because my work did not reach the quality it should have"?
Who reportedly told a nurse "Send for the priest" as a pious final request in 1540s England?
Which English king is alleged to have said "I see the Tower and the scaffold" just before execution?
Who is quoted as saying "It hurts to breathe" in the final seconds of their life in a famous assassination?
Which British naval hero's last words to a friend were the single phrase "Kiss me, Hardy"?
Who said "It is the end of an era" as last words in some modern retellings about 20th-century figures?
Which scientist reportedly murmured "I am not afraid of death" as their final reflection on mortality?
Who was said to have asked "Is it the end?" as their last words after a long illness in Victorian era?
Which composer pronounced in Italian "La mia anima è in pace" meaning "My soul is at peace"?
Who reportedly told a servant "I have tried to do my duty" as dying assurance to history?
Which French king said "I die the king's good servant, but God's first" before execution?
Who is attributed with the last words "I shall hear in heaven" referring to music and death?
Which 20th-century author reportedly said "I am ready to meet my Maker" and referenced faith at death?
Who allegedly told a doctor "I see blackness and a staircase" moments before dying in 19th-century reports?
Which explorer's last words included a practical instruction: "Get my journals and publish them"?
Who reportedly said in a famous final message: "Tell my mother I did my best" after a heroic act?
